titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that American flags flown on Federal Government buildings and on Federal property be made in the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.
Mr. Schiff moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1182.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties
committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary: 7/14/2008--Passed House without amendment. Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that all American flags flown over federal buildings should be entirely produced in the United States.
